item.title: Re: What is Worf's first name?
item.description: On Monday, January 31, 1994 at 11:37:37 AM UTC-7, Craig Allen Campbell wrote: > If > you want to get cute, it's Worf Rojhenko-Mogson. :) What, not Worf Mogovich Rodzhenko? John Savard
item.author: John Savard

item.title: Re: What is Worf's first name?
item.description: On Monday, February 7, 1994 at 12:11:05 PM UTC-7, WILLIAM F. ORR - HOFSTRA UNIVERSITY wrote: > And what is Dante's *last* name? Alghieri, IIRC. John Savard

item.title: Re: Janeway an Idiot? !! Borg to get Slipstream tech??
item.description: How weird: I'm seeing messages I wrote 17 years ago, before Google Groups even existed. It must have assimilated some other discussion group I was part of. Good times. On Friday, June 2, 2000 at 3:00:00 AM UTC-4, Gabe Waggoner wrote: > Besides, Seven said in a log entry in "Hope and Fear" that
item.author: gwag...@gmail.com

item.title: Re: What is Worf's first name?
item.description: Worf is his first name ... or more precisely the name is "Wo'riv" in Klingon. Klingon's don't have surnames, which is why they always introduce themselves as something like "Worf, son of Mogh". Worf was adopted by an Earth family, Sergey and Helena Rozhenko, but he did not take their
item.author: Your Name

item.title: What is Worf's first name?
item.description: Someone sent me this pic. It is from Nintendo Power magazine. It refers to Worf as Lt. C.J. Worf. (I googled later- wonder if Lt.C.J. refers to commander and junior.... content://media/external/file/40896
item.author: maxfre...@gmail.com

item.title: Re: [Article] What?s with All the Hate for Star Trek: Discovery?
item.description: On Monday, December 18, 2017 at 11:55:04 PM UTC-7, John Savard wrote: > (Although maybe buckwheat would be a better choice, as it's a source of complete > protein. It isn't a grass, so it is not closely enough related to rye and wheat to be possible. John Savard
item.author: John Savard

item.title: Re: [Article] What?s with All the Hate for Star Trek: Discovery?
item.description: Yes, that does sound pretty silly. But this links to TOS in a way. Remember "The Trouble With Tribbles"? What was the grain that the Tribbles ate up, creating a serious problem? Quadrotriticale. Not long before that episode aired - long enough, of course, to be before the script was

item.title: Re: [Article] What?s with All the Hate for Star Trek: Discovery?
item.description: Whether its one knee or both knees on the ground, their head is at the same height. -- Inquiring minds want to know while minds with a self-preservation instinct are running screaming.
